# zendesk_custom_statuses (Resource)

Provides a custom status resource.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# API reference:
#   https://developer.zendesk.com/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-statuses/

resource "zendesk_custom_statuses" "example" {
  status_category = "open"
  agent_label     = "In Progress"
  end_user_label  = "Working on it"
  active          = true
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `agent_label` (String) The label shown to agents.
- `status_category` (String) The status category. Allowed values: new, open, pending, hold, solved.

### Optional

- `active` (Boolean) Whether the custom status is active. Defaults to `true`.
- `default` (Boolean) Whether this is the default status for the category. Defaults to `false`.
- `description` (String) The description of the custom status.
- `end_user_hidden` (Boolean) Whether the status is hidden from end users.
- `end_user_label` (String) The label shown to end users.
- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (String) The time the custom status was created.
- `updated_at` (String) The time the custom status was last updated.
- `url` (String) The API url of this custom status.

## Notes

- Custom statuses cannot be deleted via the Zendesk API. When you remove a custom status from Terraform, it will be removed from Terraform state but will remain in Zendesk.
